Job Position: Key Account Manager - Cooperate Sales

title: Procurement Category Manager Job at Berger Paints Nigeria Plc
content:
Berger Paints Nigeria Plc is a leading paint manufacturing company with over six decades of industry excellence. With a presence in more than 10 states across Nigeria—including Lagos and Abuja—we have established a solid footprint in the nation's paints and coatings market.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our commitment to quality is reflected in the use of cutting-edge technology, state-of-the-art equipment, premium materials, and skilled expertise to produce an exceptional range of paints and coatings. These products are known not only for their superior performance but also for their innovative and functional features that set us apart in the market. At Berger Paints Nigeria, we are driven by a clear vision, and at the heart of that vision is our people. We recognise that every employee plays a vital role in the realisation of our strategic goals and objectives. This is why we place a strong emphasis on human capacity development, viewing it as a critical driver of sustainable organisational growth. Together, we are shaping a brighter, more colourful future—one coat at a time.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Category Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Designs and develops procurement plans and strategies to identify cost-effective deals.
	Develops strategies for cost reduction and decreases procurement expenses to achieve financial goals.
	Analyses market trends and makes recommendations to improve procurement effectiveness to drive performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervises the coordination and evaluation of the procurement process for the organisation.
	Oversees the end-to-end of various procurement projects.
	Approves all requisitions and purchase orders before purchase.
	Approves the ordering of necessary raw materials and goods.
	Designs and develops, and ensures implementation of procurement strategies to maintain security of supply and optimum value for money.
	Approves and reviews procurement policies and procedures.
	Tracks and reports key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness.
	Analyses market trends and makes recommendations to improve procurement effectiveness to drive performance.
	Foresees alterations with negotiations with suppliers and clients and comes to a compromise while maintaining quality standards.
	Sets policy and guidelines for delivering a cost-effective procurement process for the business.
	Builds and develops key relationships with business stakeholders and strategic supply partners to improve business.
	Develops and implements changes with newly developed processes to better procure goods and services.
	Discovers profitable suppliers and initiates business and organisation partnerships.
	Performs risk management for supply contracts and agreements.
	Controls spending and builds a culture of long-term saving on procurement costs.
	Performs other duties as assigned by the supply chain manager.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Supply Chain Management, Accounting or any related field.
	At least 3 years of experience in a similar role.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, like Excel and ERP Software.
	Good knowledge of Vendor Management and third-party management software.
	Aptitude for working with numbers.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management and planning, demand and planning principles.

title: Electrical Engineer Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited
content:
Resource Intermediaries Limited is a distinguished HR Outsourcing and Consulting firm, specializing in customized recruitment solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of companies. Our proficiency extends across a wide spectrum of positions, ranging from top-tier executives to entry-level positions, covering technical, contractual, semi-skilled, and unskilled roles. Additionally, we are recognized experts in providing a range of services including Fumigation Services, Janitorial Services, Payroll Administration, Expatriate Management, Manpower Planning, Executive Training, and more.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer
Job Location: Sanyo - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job brief


	We are looking for an electrical engineer who will help us advance our electrical products, systems, and applications.
	On a daily basis, you’ll carry out various engineering tasks, such as performing calculations to ensure our systems meet the global safety standards and collaborating with technicians and computer programmers to solve emerging issues. You’ll also research on manufacturing processes and analyze data and trends to create new products.
	Ultimately, you will improve our company’s products and processes and contribute to its growth.


Responsibilities


	Design, control, and implement electrical systems and products
	Develop manufacturing processes according to global engineering codes and standards
	Manage engineering projects and deliver them on time
	Define customer needs and requirements
	Summarize data and report on test results
	Examine needs on new equipment, calculate costs and help prepare budgets
	Ensure that installations and applications are in line with customer needs and safety standards
	Collaborate with engineers and technicians to design and apply new system processes
	Perform quality and performance analysis on new and legacy IT systems
	Monitor maintenance and inspection plans


Requirements and skills


	A degree in Electrical Engineering; MSc is a plus.
	Proven expertise as an electrical engineer
	Hands-on experience using design and calculation software
	Deep knowledge of electrical manufacturing processes
	Understanding of electrical engineering codes and safety standards
	Problem-solving abilities
	Attention to detail
	Strong organizational and communication skills


Salary
N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: vadisa@resourceintermediaries.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: HR Training Manager Job at RSIN Group
content:
RSIN was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Fuzhou, Fujian Province . we mainly conduct business in Nigeria and other western African countries. over the past 20 years of development, we have become a multinational corporation with diversified industrial clusters of iron and steel, textile, fiber chemical and lead-acid battery manufacturing based on the construction of circular economy industrial park.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Training Manager

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos

Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Based on the company's business objectives and employee needs, develop a training plan and ensure its implementation.
	Design and develop various training programs, including new employee onboarding training, skill enhancement training, leadership development training, etc.
	Regularly communicate with various departments to understand their training needs and analyze and organize them.
	Complete other tasks assigned by the leader.


Job Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree or above, with priority given to majors related to human resource management, enterprise management, etc.
	Must have at least 5 years of training work experience, and at least 3 years of training manager/supervisor or related position experience.
	Familiar with training processes and methods, possessing good course design, evaluation, and implementation abilities; Good communication and coordination skills and teamwork spirit; Proficient in using office software and training-related software.
	25-35 years old, in good health and without any bad habits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: rsingrouphr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
